modName: Rudy ENB for Vanilla Skyrim - NLVA - NLA - COT - URWL - ELFX and ENDERAL
summary: Enb for Everyone. Good performance ( I'm not joking :) and of course, stunning visuals :) Custom presets for the Vanilla, URWL, NLA, NLVA and CoT. Special version for ENDERAL.
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=3][b]This ENB config offers semi-realistic visuals and not to bad performance with all the ENB effects turned on ( really, I'm not joking :)[/b][/size][/center]

[center][color=#ff7700].................................................................................................................................................[/color][/center]

[color=#ffd966][size=5][center]NEWS:[/center][/size][/color]

[b][i][color=#fff2cc][size=4][center][size=4]BIG UPDATE :)[/size][/center][/size][/color][/i][/b]

[b][i][color=#fff2cc][size=4][center][size=4]Updated 4.0 beta (for the newest 0.349 binaries) for VANILLA and NLA. Added an animation stars effect plus a special textures for a Night Sky. Published a mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/93053] "Rudy HQ - Nordic Ruins" [/url], therefore added a separate local weathers, to updated presets, for Dungeons (Nordic Ruins) and Dwarven Ruins (Big thanks for Hasanch0o for the help :). Now these locations can be tweaked to your taste, without affecting all the others interiors.[/size][/center][/size][/color][/i][/b]

[center][color=#ff7700].................................................................................................................................................[/color][/center]

[color=#f6b26b][size=2]Modular Shader Library for ENBSeries by --JawZ-- - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61955/?] "Modular Shader Library for ENBSeries" [/url]

Kabloom code by Kermles

3D LUT,  DOF, WeatherFX by Kingeric1992

Eye Adaptation by prod80

SPELL EFFECTS by Mangaclub

Night Vision code by Scegielski - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50731/?] "Enhanced ENB Night Eye" [/url][/size][/color]



[color=#f6b26b][b][center][size=3][size=3][color=#ffe599]
[size=4]IMPORTANT THINGS:[/size][/color][/size][/size][/center][/b][/color][color=#f6b26b][b]

[color=#ffe599][size=3][b]Each of my presets is unique. They have the same "character", but each is slightly different. Try them all and choose your favorite.[/b][/size][/color][size=3]

[b][color=#f6b26b]- Please, when you will try one of my 3.0 presets, for the first time, use only the vanilla cloud textures, if you can of course. For me they are good enough and I tweaked all my weathers using them. If you use textures replacement for clouds I can't guarantee good results :)

- For the proper interior lighting use the [color=#ffe599][b]ELFX[/b][/color] mod with the [color=#ffe599][b]Enhancer[/b][/color] module.

To avoid misunderstandings:

- The [color=#ffe599][b]Vanilla[/b][/color] version - compatible only with Vanilla weather ( but Revamped Exterior Fog mod is required )
- The [color=#ffe599][b]NLA[/b][/color] version - compatible only with Natural Lighting and Atmospherics for ENB ( Natural Lighting and Atmospherics.esp )
- The [color=#ffe599][b]URWL[/b][/color] version - compatible only with ULTRA REALISTIC WORLD LIGHTING for Skyrim BETA ( SkyrimURWL.esp is required )
[color=#f6b26b][b][size=3][b][color=#f6b26b]- The [color=#ffe599]CoT[/color] version - compatible only with CLIMATES of TAMRIEL v.5  ( DEFAULT INSTALLATION is required )[/color][/b][/size][/b][/color]

- No compatibility with Vivid Weathers, ELFX Weathers - of course my preset will work with these mods, but it will not look as I wanted.

- Sharpening, Vignette and Letterbox can be adjusted in the GUI - the shaders menu - effect.txt.ini.

- !!!! If you want to use NIGHTEYE - you must download an eps file from : [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50731/?] "Enhanced ENB Night Eye" [/url] and turn it on in the shaders menu - enbeffect.fx ( scroll down ). Maybe you will have to recalibrate this effect. All functions are available in the GUI.

- !!!! A SOLUTION TO THE [color=#ffff00]"FAMOUS BLACK BARS PROBLEM"[/color] :) -> Press the tilde key, after that, press shift+enter. In the right window ( shader parameters ) expand the effect.txt menu, scroll down to the "Letterbox" section and turn it off. You can also turn off "Vignette". Remember to save changes in the left window.[/color][/b][/size]



[center][color=#fce5cd][size=4][b]How to Install ENB, by Jindo Skyrim :
[/b][/size][/color]

[youtube]6NBDKekFsg8[/youtube][/center]

[color=#ffe599][size=4]Installation:[/size]
[color=#ffe599]
STEP 1:
- Download latest [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0349.htm] ENB [/url], ( a black arrow at the bottom of the page ).
- Unzip it. Inside you will find two folders : "WrapperVersion" and "InjectorVersion".
- Copy only "d3d9.dll", "enbhost.exe", and "enblocal.ini" from "WrapperVersion" folder ( POSTING THE ENBSERIES BINARY FILES ON NEXUS SITES IS STRICTLY PROHIBITED ), into your Skyrim root directory ( usually: x:\program files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim ).

STEP 2:
- Download my mod.
- Extract it.
- Select all files from [ Skyrim folder ].
- Copy selected files into your Skyrim root directory.
- Copy files from [ Data folder ] to your "Skyrim\Data" folder.

STEP 3:
- Edit enblocal.ini, or copy ini file from my mod archive ( if you have similar hardware: Nvidia Geforce GTX 780 Ti, Intel Core i7 4790K, 32GB ram, Windows 7 x64 ), into your Skyrim root directory, remember - everyone should adapt it to own hardware !!! [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/Guide:ENBlocal_INI] Enblocal.ini Guide [/url]
- Play the game :)
[/color]



[/color][/b][/color][center][color=#f6b26b][b][color=#ffe599][b][size=3][color=#ffd966]Remember, If you are installing ELFX, make sure that you don't use ELFX Weathers !!![/color][/size][/b][/color][/b][/color][/center][color=#f6b26b][b]




[/b][/color][center][color=#f6b26b][size=4][b][color=#93c47d]if you like it, please endorse :)[/color]


[color=#93c47d]CHECK OUT MY OTHER "DARK FANTASY" PRESET:[/color]


[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/67326/?] Szarik and Gustlik ENB[/url][/b][/size][/color][/center]


[size=4]A few remarks:[/size]

- You must change these lines in SkyrimPrefs.ini

[Imagespace]
bDoDepthOfField=1

[Display]
bFloatPointRenderTarget=1
bTreesReceiveShadows=1
bDrawLandShadows=1
bShadowsOnGrass=1
bDeferredShadows=1
fGamma=1.0000
iMultiSample=0
TransparencyMultisampling=0
iBlurDeferredShadowMask=3

[Water]
bReflectSky=1

- Turn off antialiasing and anisotropic filtering in game options menu or graphic card drivers. Enb has own antialiasing and anisotropic filter.

- Make sure, that in the driver control panel, RGB "Output Dynamic Range" is set to "Full" (0-255), rather than "Limited" (16-235). Check it twice, especially if you have reinstalled or updated graphic drivers.
If the monitor has an ‘HDMI Black Level’, ‘HDMI RGB PC Range’ or similar option make sure this is also set to ‘Normal’, ‘High’, ‘Full’ or ‘RGB (0~255)’ rather than ‘Low’, ‘Limited’ or ‘RGB (16~235) - otherwise expect washed out colors

- Calibrate your monitor: [url=http://www.lagom.nl/lcd-test/black.php] LCD test [/url]. Setting the proper black level is is particularly important. My preset is designed for the monitor white balance - 6500K and Gamma 2.2

- For the better performance use ENB V-sync. Just make sure that in the "enblocal.ini", in the [ENGINE] section, "EnableVSync" is set to true, and also make sure that in the "SkyrimPrefs.ini", "iPresentInterval" ([Display] section) is set to 0

- I strongly recommend to install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30050/?] Sub Surface Full Body Map [/url] if you use UNP or Coverwomen bodies.

- For smooth working Skyrim : [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48387/?] REAL uGRIDS to load SOLUTION and MORE [/url] - Warning ! Use it on your own risk.

- Ini tweaks : [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51300/?] SkyrimPrefs and INIs for Performance and Graphics Boost [/url]





[center][size=3]For better visuals :[/size][/center]

- I recommend to download [url=http://enbseries.enbdev.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=6&t=1499] Mindflux Skyrim particle patch for ENB[/url]
